result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Timothy M Fox is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

On one or more other charges, Timothy M Fox was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Timothy M Fox is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
Branch 11

Defendant Timothy M Fox in court, in custody.  Attorney Jacob A Idlas in court for Timothy M Fox.  Attorney Lexi Keyes in court for State of Wisconsin. State moves for the CT to find cts 1 and 3 be found transactionally related; no obj from defn. CT grants motion. CT orders witnesses sequestered. Witness SPD PO Jennifer Nichols, duly sworn and testified. Direct Exam by ADA. Venue established. Cross Exam by Atty Idlas. Exam by CT. Cross exam by Atty Idlas. Witness excused at 11:17 am.  Witness SPD PO Nate Hoffmann duly sworn and testified. Direct exam by ADA Keyes. Witness identification. Cross exam by Atty Idlas. Redirect exam by ADA Keyes. Witness excused at 11:26 am State moves for bind over, waived argument, reserve rebuttal. Defn objected to bind over. Argument by Atty Idlas. CT found PC this defn committed a felony and bound over to branch 11.

CASH BAIL PREVIOUSLY POSTED OF $450 TO BE APPLIED TO THIS BOND. 
Cash bond is set in the amount of $1,000 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
_x_ Regardless of when cash bail (if required) is posted, or when a signature bond is signed, the jail shall only release the defendant if the defendant can  be outfitted directly by Pretrial Services with any required equipment prior to the defendant being released from the jail. (PRIOR APPROVAL BY PRETRIAL SERVICES REQUIRED) 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall not be at any U-Haul location. 
- Defendant shall not attempt to rent any U-Haul vehicle. 
Trial Judge - Br 11
